Garcia

The USA

Brazil

46 metres

30 metres

Date (Built)

1886

1931

How to get there

There are ferries to the statue every half an hour (in summer).

You can get there by car, taxi or a little train.

 

Which of the following is correct about Garcia?

 

A) I have been to the USA and visited the Statue of Liberty. It's a gift from France to the citizens of the USA.
B) I have been to Brazil and visited the Christ the Redeemer Statue. It was built in 1886, so it's over a hundred years old.
C) I have been to Brazil. There are ferries to the statue every half an hour in summer and it takes only 12 minutes to get there.
D) I have been to Brazil and visited the Christ the  Redeemer Statue. Paul Landowski, a French artist made it in 1931.
E) I have visited the Statue of Liberty. It is almost 46 metres high and you can reach half way up with a lift.
A B C D E

The USA

Brazil

30 metres

How to get there

There are ferries to the statue every half an hour (in summer).

E) I have visited the Statue of Liberty. It is almost 46 metres high and you can reach half way up with a lift.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14215

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

The story of Benjamin Button begins in the summer of 1860. Roger Button goes to the hospital to meet his newborn son. He gets shocked to find that his baby is actually a 70 year old man. Benjamin is born at 70 and gets younger while everyone else gets older. His parents are filled with the shame of their abnormal child, so they force him to act like a baby even though Benjamin has the body and mind of a much older man. Benjamin is an easy-going guy in spite of his abnormality. He appears to be fifty (he is twenty, though); he falls in love with a beautiful young woman, Hildegarde Moncrief. They marry and have a son, Roscoe. Unfortunately, while Hildegarde gets older, Benjamin gets younger, so he quickly loses interest in his wife. Benjamin goes to the Spanish - American war. He gets younger every year. By the time he returns, he and his son are nearly at the same age. Benjamin continues to grow younger and finally he enters Harvard College when he looks about eighteen. By the time he graduates, he is young enough to go to prepschool. Roscoe is increasingly upset with his father because his own son is approaching Benjamin's age. Benjamin and his grandson end up playing together as children.

What is abnormal about Benjamin Button?

A) He lived more than 100 years.
B) He survived the most terrifying war.
C) He died at the age of 75.
D) He gets younger as the years pass by.
E) He had serious mental illnesses.
A B C D E

Which of the following option is true according to Martha's, Daniel's, and Craig's hobbies? 

Martha: I like arts and crafts. It’s relaxing. I’m a creative person and I like doing things with my hands but watching documentary isn’t very me. I find it boring.

Daniel: I am really keen on surfing. I enjoy doing water sports, but I hate chess. It seems very confusing to me.

Craig: I’m fond of taking photos. It’s an interesting activity. I like being out of the house and to discover new things, but I really don’t like gardening. I think it’s exhausting.

A) Craig likes gardening, but he is not fond of taking photos.
B) Art and crafts is Martha’s favourite hobby, but she doesn’t like watching documentaries.
C) Daniel hates doing water sports because he thinks it is dangerous.
D) Craig likes being at home and doing gardening.
E) Daniel is keen on playing chess because he finds it interesting.
A B C D E

Everyone wants to be happy in their life. Some find it easy to be happy. Others spend a lifetime for happiness and they can't find it. Some people think that money or having many expensive things will make them happy. But do they really make one truly happy? Now I have a little recipe that isn't hard to make but don't just bake it in the oven, spread it everywhere! Take a big mixing bowl and fill it with 2 cups of patience. Add 1 heartful of love and 2 handfuls of mindfulness. Put a big bottle of laughter and a handful of understanding. Sprinkle some kindness and faith. Mix them well. Serve anyone you meet. 

Which of the following cannot be the title of the text?

A) Recipe for Happiness
B) True Happiness
C) Money Brings Happiness
D) Serve Happiness to Everybody
E) Be Generous to Spread Happiness
A B C D E

Which question has an answer in the paragraph?

My name's Cameron. I'm 25 years old. I am an intern doctor and I work in a big hospital in the city centre. I have a busy work life and very long working hours. I get up very early in the morning. I don't have time for breakfast, so I just drink a cup of coffee and eat a toast at the hospital. I take the underground to work because it's faster. I work six days a week and I'm on call for three nights. My off day changes every week, so I have limited time to spend with the whole family. On my day off, I just stay at home and rest. I lie on the sofa and watch comedy films on TV.

A) What time does Cameron leave home for work?
B) What does Cameron do on her day off?

Ella: I like outdoor activities. My favourite is cycling in the park. I’m also fond of rollerblading with my friends.

Joe: I play in a music band. We play every kind of music, but my favourite is rap. We’re really excited now because we have a concert next week.

Nicole: I’m good at sports. I can play volleyball and tennis very well. I can also swim, but I can’t dive. I want to take diving classes.

B) Jim
C) Martin
D) Joe
E) Nicole
A B C D E

We love speaking different languages. I also enjoy speaking to local people in their own language. It is really interesting.

 

A) The Best Way to Learn a Language
B) Travelling is the Best Way to Relax
C) Why Do People Travel?
D) Local People of Kenya
E) An Interesting Country
A B C D E

When people visit or stay in places outside their usual environment for leisure, business or other purposes, we can call it 'tourism'. It has many types such as adventure tourism, ecotourism and culinary tourism are some of the well known types. If you travel for having exciting or unusual experiences, you can try adventure tourism. It means you can take part in physically challenging outdoor activites. If you are a true nature lover, ecotourism meets your needs. On the other hand, if you travel for tasting local and traditional food of different cultures, culinary tourism suits you perfectly.

 

A) Ecotourism lets you join challenging outdoor activities.
B) True nature lovers prefer culinary tourism. 
C) Tasting traditional and local food is the aim of culinary tourism.
D) Adventure tourism lets you taste local food.
E) There are only three types of tourism.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

Which of the following completes the sentence according to the paragraph?

Today I got up at 6 as usual and it was a foggy morning, so I sipped my coffee enjoying the scenery outside the tent. I had some salty and juicy food for breakfast as I got dehydrated in the boiling sun yesterday. You have to drink gallons of water to cool down if you're working outside in the sun. It was the third day of the excavation and we did quite a lot today. We realised how tired we were when we sat for lunch. It wasn't a big lunch, just a piece of toast and coffee. In the afternoon we continued our routine work digging the soil, cleaning the recovered artefacts and numbering the pieces. While dining, we planned the next day's duties. Tomorrow will be a tough day as it always is. So, I'm going to bed early and listening to music to get relaxed before falling asleep, as usual. Bye for now! 

According to the passage, the author ...... .

A) generally gets up early
B) always goes to bed late
C) never has breakfast
D) dislikes drinking coffee in the morning
E) is working in an office
A B C D E

I had some salty and juicy food for breakfast as I got dehydrated in the boiling sun yesterday. You have to drink gallons of water to cool down if you're working outside in the sun. It was the third day of the excavation and we did quite a lot today. We realised how tired we were when we sat for lunch. It wasn't a big lunch, just a piece of toast and coffee. In the afternoon we continued our routine work digging the soil, cleaning the recovered artefacts and numbering the pieces. While dining, we planned the next day's duties. Tomorrow will be a tough day as it always is. So, I'm going to bed early and listening to music to get relaxed before falling asleep, as usual. Bye for now! 
According to the passage, the author ...... .
options: dislikes drinking coffee in the morning

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14295

Which of the following is the best title for the text?

Today I got up at 6.00 as usual and it was a foggy morning, so I sipped my coffee enjoying the scenery outside the tent. I had some salty and juicy food for breakfast as I got dehydrated in the boiling sun yesterday. You have to drink gallons of water to cool down if you're working outside in the sun. It was the third day of the excavation and we did quite a lot today. We realised how tired we were when we sat for lunch. It wasn't a big lunch, just a piece of toast and coffee. In the afternoon we continued our routine work digging the soil, cleaning the recovered artefacts and numbering the pieces. While dining, we planned the next day's duties. Tomorrow will be a tough day as it always is. So, I'm going to bed early and listening to music to get relaxed before falling asleep, as usual. Bye for now! 

 

A) How to Make an Excavation
B) Getting up Early
C) Eating the Same Things
D) Dining is Important
E) A Routine of a Worker
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14306

Which of the following is not mentioned in the paragraph? 

Gordion is close to the village of Yassıhöyük. It was the capital city of the Phrygian Empire. The remains of Gordion are about 100 km from Ankara and 29 km northwest of Polatlı. The mount is located above the  Sakarya River and Porsuk Creek. The first excavations started in 1901 and still continue today. As a result of excavations, the city gate, palace remains and houses have been discovered. There are about 35 tumuli in the ancient Gordion city. The most famous tumulus  is the King Midas’s Tomb. According to the legend, King Midas was a greedy king and wanted  everything he touched to turn into gold. We can see the remains in Ankara Anatolian Civilizations Museum and Gordion Museum.

A) The excavations are ongoing today.
B) King Midas’s Tomb was the biggest of all the tumuli.
C) The ancient Gordion city is located close to Ankara.
D) People can see some remains from the ancient city in Anatolian Civilizations Museum.
E) The excavations started at the beginning of the twentieth century.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 52497

Read the text and choose the best option.

Last Summer was a great experience for me and my family. We had such an interesting journey that we could hardly forget. We went to Barcelona and spent three days there. Although we had a very limited time, we tried not to miss any single activity in this beautiful place. The city was so amazing with its historical buildings. One of the fascinating things in our vacation were Gaudi’s famous works. First, we visited “La Sagrada Familia”. It was a breathtaking church. We were all astonished by this architectural wonder. Gaudi started to build this dreamlike work in 1882, and the construction lasted more than a century, and it is still not completed. Then we visited his another interesting work, a building called “Casa Mila”, a very best example of the contemporary architecture. It was different from other buildings. We couldn’t see Gaudi’s Güell Park because we were all exhausted and hungry, so we found ourselves in the very famous and the longest street “La Rambla”. We tried their local food “Paella” and “Tapas”. They were all delicious. We liked their taste very much, but my father didn’t like the Paella because of the seafood in it. We visited Picasso’s museum and watched Flamenco dances the next day and we did some shopping. My mom bought some souvenirs for home, and we returned with unforgetable memories.            

A) The narrator couldn’t forget their holiday because they got into trouble in Barcelona.
B) The narrator visited all the historical buildings but he didn’t like Güell Park.
C) They went to La Rambla because they were all hungry and tired.
D) All the family members liked the local food.
E) The narrator’s mother bought some gifts for their relatives.
A B C D E

Billy Eilish: Hmmm… Inspiration is everywhere. It’s in the nature, in the literature, in art…
Reporter: Thank you, Billy.
options: She was just a small kid when she started singing.
Her song “Lovely” was a world-wide hit.
She started her singing career in a musical at school.
Everything inspired her while writing her songs.

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14334

Choose the correct option to complete the sentence.

Today I got up at 6.00 as usual and it was a foggy morning, so I sipped my coffee enjoying the scenery outside the tent. I had some salty and juicy food for breakfast as I got dehydrated in the boiling sun yesterday. You have to drink gallons of water to cool down if you're working outside in the sun. It was the third day of the excavation and we did quite a lot today. We realised how tired we were when we sat for lunch. It wasn't a big lunch, just a piece of toast and coffee. In the afternoon, we continued our routine work digging the soil, cleaning the recovered artefacts and numbering the pieces. While dining, we planned the next day's duties. Tomorrow will be a tough day as it always is. So, I'm going to bed early and listening to music to get relaxed before falling asleep, as usual. Bye for now! 

We learn from the passage that if you work outside, .... .

A) you should plan duties of the next day
B) you have to drink lots of water
C) you must go to bed very early
D) you have to have salty and juicy food
E) you can continue your routine work
A B C D E

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

Gizem, Hüseyin and Ali are English teachers from different cities. They are going to meet in İstanbul for a seminar on December 17. They are going to stay at a 5 star hotel in Harbiye for 5 days. They are looking forward to working together and having a wonderful time in İstanbul, the city of dreams. It will be a different experience for them because they are going to prepare questions for the students countrywide. They are going to work from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. After work everyday, they are planning to do different activities in İstanbul. For example, Ali and Hüseyin are going to go to a football match in Dolmabahçe on Wednesday. Gizem has a different plan for the same day. She is going to meet some of her old friends from university. They are planning to see the perfect view of İstanbul from the Sapphire Tower. Hüseyin wants to take a city tour on Thursday. Ali is going to visit the Topkapı Palace and take some photos. On Friday evening, they are going to take a boat tour altogether. They hope to be back home with great memories.

Which of the following is not the plan of the teachers? 

A) They are going to prepare questions for the students countrywide.
B) Ali and Hüseyin are going to go to football match.
C) Gizem is going to meet with her old friends.
D) They are going to visit Dolmabahçe Palace.
E) They are going to take a boat tour.
A B C D E

Oliver: We must buy decaffeinated coffee instead of the one we have had so far.
Rebecca: But you know, we all like caffeinated coffee in the office because it keeps us awake during the day!
Oliver: Maybe you are right, but decaffeinated coffee is healthier and better for our health.
Jacob: ......, but Tom is on the phone. He says it is urgent.
Oliver: Ok. Let’s take a short break, and we’ll continue later.
options: I was just going to say that

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 52539

Find the best option for the blank in the dialogue. 

Company owner Mr. Wayne is having a meeting with Company’s managers and directors like Mr. Garrison. Mr. Garrison is the top manager in the company.                                                                                                                 

Mr. Wayne: We must work hard because we need bigger sales in Europe. If we do that, we can open new branches in Australia and New Zealand.

Mr. Garrison: ...... .                                                                        

Mr. Wayne: Of course, go ahead.

A) I’d say exactly the opposite
B) I’m not so sure about it
C) Can I add something here
D) Never in a million years
E) Well, let me think
A B C D E
questionText: Find the best option for the blank in the dialogue. Company owner Mr. Wayne is having a meeting with Company’s managers and directors like Mr. Garrison. Mr. Garrison is the top manager in the company. Mr. Wayne: We must work hard because we need bigger sales in Europe. If we do that, we can open new branches in Australia and New Zealand. Mr. Garrison: ...... . Mr. Wayne: Of course, go ahead. A) I’d say exactly the opposite B) I’m not so sure about it C) Can I add something here D) Never in a million years E) Well, let me think A B C D E
question:

Mr. Wayne: We must work hard because we need bigger sales in Europe. If we do that, we can open new branches in Australia and New Zealand.

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 52540

Choose the option that best completes the blank below.

Speaker 1: You know that we have a new project. Shall we start working on it now?  

Speaker 2: ......, but I have an important meeting in half an hour.

Speaker 1: Oh, do you?  No problem at all. We’ll continue tomorrow.

Speaker 2: Thank you.

A) I am not busy
B) We are on holiday
C) I’m sorry to interrupt
D) I am not feeling well
E) You don’t have any snacks here
A B C D E
questionText: Choose the option that best completes the blank below. Speaker 1: You know that we have a new project. Shall we start working on it now? Speaker 2: ......, but I have an important meeting in half an hour. Speaker 1 : Oh, do you?  No problem at all. We’ll continue tomorrow. Speaker 2 : Thank you. A) I am not busy B) We are on holiday C) I’m sorry to interrupt D) I am not feeling well E) You don’t have any snacks here A B C D E

Choose the correct option to complete the dialogue.

Jane: Hi Jake, I have a birthday party tomorrow. Would you like to come?

Jack: ...... , is it OK if I inform you later?

Jane : You have time to think about that. Will you call me back for your last decision?

A) I would love to, but I can't.
B) I hope so
C) Sounds great
D) Well
E) Absolutely
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 52542

Find the best option to complete the blank in the dialogue below.

Matthew: You know what happened last night?

Christopher: What?

 Matthew: A few local boys visited our new building site and stole the floor tiles we bought four weeks ago.

Christopher: No worries. I wanted to change them with new ones because I didn’t like the pattern and colour at all. ......, we’ll go and buy new ones right away.                                                                                                                           

Matthew: All right, you’re the boss.

A) Sorry
B) Anyway
C) No doubt
D) I knew
E) No chance
A B C D E
questionText: Find the best option to complete the blank in the dialogue below. Matthew: You know what happened last night? Christopher: What? Matthew: A few local boys visited our new building site and stole the floor tiles we bought four weeks ago. Christopher: No worries. I wanted to change them with new ones because I didn’t like the pattern and colour at all. ......, we’ll go and buy new ones right away. Matthew : All right, you’re the boss. A) Sorry B) Anyway C) No doubt D) I knew E) No chance A B C D E
question:
Find the best option to complete the blank in the dialogue below.
Matthew: You know what happened last night?
Christopher: What?
Matthew: A few local boys visited our new building site and stole the floor tiles we bought four weeks ago.
Christopher: No worries. I wanted to change them with new ones because I didn’t like the pattern and colour at all. ....., we’ll go and buy new ones right away.
Matthew: All right, you’re the boss.
